faqs.question: How do I register for courses?
faqs.answer: Course registration begins after consulting with your academic advisor and registration is usually done during end of semester breaks. Login to your student portal, select 'Course Registration', choose your courses for the semester, and submit the form for approval. Registration is only complete after your advisor approves your selection.

faqs.question: What's the deadline for admissions?
faqs.answer: For Fall semester, the application deadline is typically May 31. For Spring semester, the deadline is October 31. International students should apply at least 3 months before these deadlines to allow time for visa processing.

faqs.question: Where can I find the academic calendar?
faqs.answer: The academic calendar is available on the AUN website under 'Academics' or directly at https://www.aun.edu.ng/academics/academic-calendar. It contains important dates for registration, classes, examinations, and holidays.

faqs.question: How can I contact student services?
faqs.answer: You can reach Student Services by email at studentservices@aun.edu.ng, by phone at +234-8012345678, or by visiting their office in the Administration Building between 9am-5pm Monday to Friday.

faqs.question: What accommodation options are available?
faqs.answer: AUN offers both on-campus and off-campus housing. On-campus options include single and shared rooms in various residence halls. Off-campus accommodations can be arranged through the Housing Office. Priority for on-campus housing is given to international and first-year students.

faqs.question: How do I apply for financial aid?
faqs.answer: To apply for financial aid, submit the Financial Aid Application Form available on the student portal along with required supporting documents showing financial need. Applications for the next academic year should be submitted by March 31.

faqs.question: What dining options are available on campus?
faqs.answer: AUN has several dining options including the main cafeteria in the Student Center, the Faculty Lounge, and various caf√©s across campus. Meal plans are available for students and can be purchased through the Student Services office.

faqs.question: How can I join student clubs?
faqs.answer: Information about student clubs can be found at the Student Activities office or on the student portal. Most clubs have recruitment drives during the first two weeks of each semester where you can sign up. You can also start a new club by submitting a proposal to the Student Government Association.

faqs.question: What is the school policy on attendance, exams and academic probation?
faqs.answer: AUN has a strict policy of a 75% attendance requirement to be eligible for examinations. If a student's CGPA falls below 2.0, they receive a warning. If the grade doesn't improve the next semester, the student is placed on academic probation.

faqs.question: How is grading done in AUN?
Is it possible to get other types of grades?
faqs.answer: AUN has other grading formats: I (Incomplete) - granted when a student misses a final exam for valid reasons; W (Withdrawal) - when a student drops a course before deadline; AU (Audit) - attending without credit; P/F (Pass/Fail) - used for some courses.
